stimulusHtml: Let f be a function that has derivatives of all orders for all real numbers, and let P3(x) be the third-degree Taylor polynomial for f about x = 0. The Taylor series for f about x = 0 converges at x = 1, and | f ( n ) ( x ) | ≤ n n + 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4863@ , for  1 ≤ n ≤ 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EF1@ and all values of x. Of the following, which is the smallest value of k for which the Lagrange error bound guarantees that | f ( 1 ) − P 3 ( 1 ) | ≤ k MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47A5@ ?
choicesHtml: 4 5 · 1 4 ! MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E8D@

4 5 · 1 3 ! MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E8C@

3 4 · 1 4 ! MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E8B@

3 4 · 1 3 ! MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E8A@
